description:
Master and Commander: The True Story
Fans of Patrick OÃ¢â‚¬â„¢BrianÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s novels stand by for a fine documentary deconstructing the 2003 film based on his stories of naval warfare, Master and Commander: the Far Side of the World. There, Russell Crowe starred as OÃ¢â‚¬â„¢BrianÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s hero Captain Aubrey, and defeated a French super-frigate. As director Peter Weir explains, the story has been switched from BritainÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s War of 1812 with the US and the technologically advanced vessel was the USS Constitution.
An examination of the historical accuracy of the film Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World, The programme explores naval warfare in the 19th century and the construction secrets of the USS Constitution, which the movie's Acheron ship was a based on. A descendant of Admiral Thomas Cochrane reveals the similarities between the screen exploits of Russell Crowe and the real-life
Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World premiered in 2003 and received 10 nominations for Academy Awards, including best picture.
